node.title: New Plymouth's fatbergs: Residents urged to just flush the three Ps
node.description: A fatberg which caused a sewage overflow in New Plymouth recently has highlighted problems caused by residents pouring cooking fat down the kitchen sink.

node.title: The Thai festival that honours the river goddess has begun polluting the water it reveres
node.description: Experts say the small, decorated 'krathongs' that believers float into the water on Loy Krathong are clogging the very waterways they seek to honour.

node.title: Sydney scientist's pioneering work inspired by India's 'waste warriors'
node.description: It was in the bazaars of Mumbai, India where NSW Australian of the Year Veena Sahajwalla first saw what was possible with other people's trash.

node.title: Hidden in plain sight, this endangered native daisy is making a comeback
node.description: In Melbourne's north-west, the button wrinklewort is bucking the trend as other species head towards extinction.

node.title: This pile of trash is 40m deep, but among it are things that shouldn't be there
node.description: From dirty nappies to green waste, the Werribee tip in Melbourne's south-west accepts 270,000 tonnes of landfill every year. But now there are plans to convert some of the rubbish into energy.

node.title: A 14yo texted her friend 'something bad' would happen — 12 hours later she killed another child
node.description: A spotlight is on the "severe shortage" of mental health support in rural Australia after a NSW teenager with a troubled history killed a 10-year-old girl.

node.title: Michael Cohen to be released from house arrest
node.description: The former Trump attorney will be released from house arrest after serving a three-year sentence.

node.title: When the Police Kill Without Cause
node.description: A Times investigation sheds light on an unjust practice.

node.title: The Diminishing Democratic Majority
node.description: Do Democrats need Trump to save them from an unexpected demographic eclipse?

node.title: Thousands in Austria Protest Virus Lockdown and Vaccine Mandate
node.description: The protests were largely peaceful, but as dusk fell over the Austrian capital, skirmishes broke out between officers and groups of demonstrators

node.title: Indian police charge local Amazon executives over marijuana trade
node.description: Police estimate about 1,000kg of marijuana, worth about $US148,000 ($204,000), was sold in Indian via Amazon.

node.title: Ethiopian artefacts stolen by British soldiers returned after 150 years
node.description: The Ethiopian government is still fighting for Britain to return other stolen artefacts, including sacred wooden and stone tablets, which represent the Ark of the Covenant.

node.title: All Blacks want to match French flair
node.description: The All Blacks expect traditional French style while the Les Bleus are using Sunday's match as a benchmark.

node.title: The deadly new risk Afghan women face: It starts with a strange phone call and can end with murder
node.description: There were warnings that women's rights activists in Afghanistan were in danger, Now, they are disappearing and being killed in the streets.

node.title: No jab, no job: Why Chantal has chosen to quit rather than get the COVID vaccine
node.description: Chantal has baked her final loaf in a job she loves, choosing to leave rather than get the COVID vaccine. She's not alone, with business owners fearing a worker drought when government-mandated vaccine rules soon kick in.

node.title: Delays warning: Work to begin on stabilising rockface on SH6
node.description: Motorists could face half an hour delays while travelling towards Murchison on State Highway 6 from next week.

node.title: Firearm apparently discharged by accident at Atlanta airport, police say
node.description: "There is not an active shooter," Hartsfield-Jackson Atlanta International Airport Twitter tweeted.

node.title: Thanksgiving Forecast: Mostly Clear With Minor Travel Delays Possible
node.description: Weak storms could cause flight delays in some parts of the country but forecasters do not expect any major disruptions.

node.title: Covid Christmas may leave clinics cheerless
node.description: General practitioners are preparing to navigate the holiday season with a potential surge in Covid-19 cases, as the virus continues to spread across the country.

node.title: Most White Women With No College Degree Say Biden Did Not Legitimately Beat Trump: Poll
node.description: According to the Economist/YouGov survey, more non-college educated white women said that Donald Trump is "likely" to be reinstated as president before the end of the year.

node.title: What are my chances of getting long COVID if I'm fully vaccinated?
node.description: Vaccination reduces the risk of severe disease, but what does it mean for long COVID? Here's what the science says.

node.title: Covid-19: New locations of interest in Bay of Plenty
node.description: There are 35 new locations of interest today, including bars and nightclubs in Mount Maunganui, and reports of a case in Hawke's Bay.

node.title: Biden is the first president to turn 79 while in office
node.description: Born on November 20, 1942, Mr. Biden's birthday is Saturday.

node.title: Kyle Rittenhouse Lawyer Says 'Idiot' Lin Wood Tried to 'Whore This Kid Out for Money'
node.description: Mark Richards said the pro-Trump attorney would "probably sue me," noting they went head to head earlier in the trial.

node.title: An activist, a director and an MMA fighter: Harry Potter stars have come a long way from Hogwarts, 20 years on
node.description: It's been 20 years since the release of Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone, which inspired a new generation of Potterheads and skyrocketed the young cast to superstardom. Here's what they've been up to since.

node.title: I've grieved derailed career plans and gone on wild diets, but I've finally come to appreciate my disability
node.description: Although I've had to grieve my past self, my disability, Myalgic encephalomyelitis, has freed me from the weight of my own expectations about who I should be — and helped me become braver than I ever imagined, writes Alice Rumble.

node.title: Four friends, one album and a disaster of epic proportions: A fresh look inside the Beatles' last stand
node.description: What The Beatles: Get Back will show is that all the elements of the band's break-up were there in January 1969, along with the good things. But as history tell us, sooner or later something had to give.

node.title: Just like Sparta and Athens, America and China are on a collision course
node.description: The Thucydides Trap states that when a rising power meets a waning one, war becomes inevitable. But China-US relations are more complicated than a simple power battle, writes Stan Grant.

node.title: Giving New Zealand writers a Sporting chance
node.description: A starting point for many of Aotearoa's great writers, Sport folded last year after over 30 years in the New Zealand literary scene, but a new best-of collection explores the magazine's rich legacy. Audio

node.title: Immigration Advisor with 'history of deception' ordered to pay $26k in penalties
node.description: A tribunal says migrants need to be protected from an adviser whose systemic deceptions left a couple unlawfully in the country.
